content:
1. Use removable wallpaper or wall decals to add pattern and color to walls without painting or damaging them.

2. Create a gallery wall using overlooked items, such as vintage record covers, postcards, or pages from old books.

3. Add some greenery with plants that are easy to take care of, such as succulents or air plants. You can also find affordable planters at thrift stores, dollar stores, or online.

4. Use mirrors strategically to make space look larger and brighter. Mirrors can also be found at thrift stores or estate sales for a bargain.

5. Create a cozy reading nook by layering a rug, some cushions, and a throw on the floor next to a bookshelf or window.

6. Use string lights to add ambiance and soften the lighting in your space.

7. DIY your own wall art by framing pages from old books, maps, or calendars.

8. Upcycle old furniture with a coat of paint or a new upholstery cover. You can also find affordable furniture at thrift stores or garage sales.

9. Use a decorative screen or curtain to separate different areas of the apartment instead of building walls.

10. Hang curtains higher than the window to create the illusion of a taller ceiling.
